DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate whether circulatory management base LiDCOrapid hemodynamic monitoring reduce incidence acute kidney injury patient undergo partial nephrectomy compare routine circulatory management base blood pressure urine output monitoring
DOC.brief_title: Circulatory Management Acute Kidney Injury Patients Undergoing Partial Nephrectomy
DOC.detailed_description: Previous study find incidence acute kidney injury afer partial nephrectomy high 30 % . In addition nephron loss induce renal parenchyma resection , ischemia/reperfusion injury produce clamping/unclamping renal artery also important reason . However , study investigate effect circulatory management incidence acute kidney injury partial nephrectomy limit . It show perioperative hemodynamic optimization protect renal function surgical patient . And patient undergoing renal transplantation , adequate hydration optimal perfusion enhances early graft function . The investigator hypothesize hydration circulatory management guarantee optimal renal perfusion may decrease occurrence acute kidney injury partial nephrectomy . The purpose study investigate whether circulatory management base LiDCOrapid hemodynamic monitoring reduce incidence acute kidney injury patient undergo partial nephrectomy compare routine circulatory management base blood pressure urine output monitoring .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age > 18 year ; 2 . Planning undergo partial nephrectomy ; 1 . Patients renal function damage ( chronic kidney disease stage 35 ) surgery ; 2 . Patients arrhythmia aortic valve disease ( moderate high degree stenosis/regurgitation ) ; 3 . Patients participated trial .
